definition[0]: the condition of only just having enough money or food to stay alive
example[0]: Many of the families are forced to live at the subsistence level.
example[1]: The land provided subsistence and little more.
definition[1]: a small amount of money or food that is just enough to survive on
example[2]: Refugees are dependent for subsistence on support from aid agencies.
example[3]: Unfortunately, these people have become used to living at subsistence levels (=with just enough food etc to survive).
example[4]: Foreign workers are paid subsistence wages by local standards.
definition[2]: farming in which farmers produce just enough food for their families to live on
